bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BARROW:H.R. 6144.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 9 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates.[Page H5009]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

summary.text: Limits the amount of funding available to the General Services Administration (GSA) for FY2012 and for each fiscal year thereafter for the acquisition of new vehicles for the federal fleet to 80% of the amount available for such vehicles for FY2011. Exempts from such limitation amounts for the acquisition of new vehicles for national security purposes.

bill.title: To reduce amounts available to the General Services Administration for the acquisition of new vehicles for the Federal fleet.

item.title: To reduce amounts available to the General Services Administration for the acquisition of new vehicles for the Federal fleet.
To reduce amounts available to the General Services Administration for the acquisition of new vehicles for the Federal fleet.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
